citation.article-title: Tropicimonas isoalkanivorans gen. nov., sp. nov., a branched-alkane-degrading bacterium isolated from Semarang Port in Indonesia.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Tropicimonas isoalkanivorans sp. nov.
Tropicimonas isoalkanivorans (i.so.al.ka.ni.vo′rans. N.L. neut n. isoalkanum branched alkane; L. part. adj. vorans devouring; N.L. part. adj. isoalkanivorans degrading branched alkanes).
The description is identical to that for the genus, with the following additions.
Growth occurs between 10 and 46 °C (optimum 37 °C), at pH 5.5–8.0 (optimum pH 7.6) and at NaCl concentrations of 1–6 % (w/v) (optimum 3 %).
Able to degrade n-alkanes (C10–C17), branched alkanes and methylnaphthalenes.
Decane, pristane and methylnaphthalene are utilized for growth.

The following Biolog GN2 test substrates were scored as positive: dextrin, l-arabinose, adonitol, cellobiose, d-galactose, d-mannitol, melibiose, d-fructose, d-glucose, maltose, d-mannose, d-sorbitol, sucrose, glycerol, turanose, xylitol, trehalose, lactic acid, l-glutamic acid, l-alanine, l-serine, thymidine, l-proline and uridine.

The following Biolog GN2 test substrates were scored as negative: Tweens 80 and 40, urocanic acid, sebacic acid, valeric acid, malonic acid, lactulose, gentiobiose, citric acid, succinamic acid, l-fructose, d-lactose, acetic acid, propionic acid, succinic acid, l-threonine, l-histidine, d-alanine, l-leucine, l-phenylalanine, l-threonine and d-serine.
Susceptible to (μg ml–1) ampicillin (50), chloramphenicol (20), gentamicin (50), kanamycin (20), nalidixic acid (50), spectinomycin (15), streptomycin (20) and tetracycline (10).
The predominant fatty acids are C18 : 1ω7c, C18 : 1ω9c, C16 : 0, C18 : 0 and anteiso-C15 : 0.
The type strain, B51T (=JCM 14837T=DSM 19548T), was isolated from seawater in Semarang Port, Java, Indonesia.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 66.5 mol%.
